intro: Olfersia sellowiana, commonly known as the Amazonian nightshade, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. Its fruits are yellow berries that contain toxic seeds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Olfersia sellowiana is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its habitat.
